title:
The #IndieWeb approach *is* the simpler day-to-day approach.

Once you setup your domain & provider (or host/CMS), you always know where to post. 

Your own site.

Write first, defer “destination decisions”.

Create first, edit for audience(s) second. 

It’s refreshing & liberating.

Whether text, photos, videos, podcasts, brief thoughts, thinking out loud, a considered essay or “thought piece”, or replies to any of the above, start with your own site.

Why burden yourself with having to decide what to post based on:
* Will this fit in 140^H^H^H 280 characters?
* Or 500?
* Does it need a title?
* Will my photos/videos fit their aspect ratio limits?
* Which four photos for this album? Or 10? What one aspect ratio to crop them all into?
* Will my video fit in 15, 30, 90, or 140 seconds?
* Will I upset Big Chad or be subject to selective enforcement of ever-changing policies?
* Can I edit my post after publishing?

By decoupling creating from “distribution”, or “audience”, or “reach”, or the size of someone else’s storage boxes, you are free to express your thoughts first, then optionally decide if you want to share them elsewhere and edit as necessary.

If you do want to syndicate (POSSE) your post, then you can decide:
* Where else to send your post
* Is it worth your time to edit your post for any particular destination
* … their content limits (number of characters/photos, or video length)
* … their audience expectations or terms of service sensitivities

Creating and editing are different mental tasks.

Decoupling them makes posting easier and you can do a better job at both. 

You can defer destination decisions & editing to some point in the future entirely, when you feel it’s worth your time.

You decide how and when to spend time creating vs editing. You are in control.

This is day 5 of #100DaysOfIndieWeb #100Days

last_post.content:
“What do we want in a research platform of the future?” Session I’m moderating at MLA, Jan. 7, 5.15-6:30 pm (#mla23 #s620). More info: https://infotech.mla.hcommons.org/2022/mla2023-s620/

It’s one of two sessions organized by MLA’s Committee on Info Tech #mlaCIT. The idea is to prompt scholars to get ahead of the curve: “Instead of just critiquing major IT platforms that higher-ed institutions commit to, panelists ‘lead with the solution.’” (My intro will be about “Thinking at the ‘Enterprise Technology Systems’ Level.”)

You can have C symmetry with C² = 1, C symmetry with C² = -1, or no C symmetry.

You can have C symmetry with T² = 1, T symmetry with T² = -1, or no T symmetry.

That makes 3×3 = 9 options. The tenth option is S symmetry without C or T symmetry. In this case we can assume S² = 1.

But this is just the beginning of a very beautiful story! Here's my online intro to the tenfold way:

https://math.ucr.edu/home/baez/tenfold.html

Maybe I'll say more here later... when I figure some stuff out.

(4/n, n = 4)

Nazi Germany Used Honorary Consuls to Advance Agenda Globally, Records Show
--
ProPublica & ICIJ used declassified intelligence documents and media accounts to ID about 20 honorary consuls suspected of supporting the Third Reich through espionage & other illicit activities.

They largely lived & worked in neutral countries in Latin America, Europe & Africa, where Nazis sought to cultivate allies or gain an advantage.

https://www.propublica.org/article/shadow-diplomats-nazi-germany-spies-honorary-consuls

title: Free energy and specific heat near a quantum critical point of a metal

last_post.content: Today's #arXivsummary: https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.01873 by Zhang et. al. Authors study the free energy and specific heat for fermions interacting with gapless bosons at a quantum-critical point (QCP) in a metal. Three cases considered: Ising-nematic QCP, AFM QCP, & QCP for electrons interacting with Einstein phonons. Specific heat in the full fermion-boson model is independent of the cutoff and is positive all the way up to QCP. #CondMat #StrEl #arXiv_2301_01873
